Hello

The C++ code where I use cantera is a multithreaded application. But it
will certainly in the future run on parallel machines.

Violaine Louvet.

Bert Bell a �crit :
> Hello
> 
>  
> 
> Are you using a C++ that has been adapted for operation on parallel machines
> or running a multithreaded application?
> 
>  
> 
> I have no personal experience with parallel C++ but for a multithreaded
> application you would need multiple instances of the IdealGasMix class (well
> you could share one instance but each thread would need exclusive access to
> the instance during the entire time it was setting the instance state, doing
> a reaction calculation and then retrieving results.)
> 
>  
> 
> R. F. (Bert) Bell
> 
> Enginomix, LLC

> P.O. Box 850

> Violaine Louvet
> Sent: Friday, February 09, 2007 2:18 AM
> To: cantera@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [cantera] using cantera in a parallel code
> 
>  
> 
> 
> Hello
> 
> I would like to use cantera in a C++ parallel code for combustion 
> computation.
> Do I have to use independent instances of the class IdealGasMix for each 
> element of my parallel loops or is there another way to do it ?
> 
> Thanks
> 
> Violaine Louvet.
>
